intro: Agrostemma nicaeense, commonly known as the Cyprus thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the island of Cyprus. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats like grasslands and scrublands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
